channel.title: robots.txt on norsey's hideout

item.title: is robots.txt dead? lets ask dropbox
item.description: First off I’d like to give creds to Francis Brown and Rob Ragan who presented their talk Tenacious Diggity at DEFCON 20Â where I found out about the apparent steam-rolling of Dropbox’s robots.txt file. For as far back as I can remember, the robots.txt file has been a ban-list of places that search engine crawlers are supposed to ignore when crawling a site. Recently however there is some talk that the preferred way of disallowing crawlers is to control them using alternative methods such as metatags and javascript.
